attributes.action: Enforce stricter penalties on parents who don't pay their child support payments
attributes.background: Throughout the country there are more than 700,000 families with dependant children who are presently owed more than £1 billion in unpaid child maintenance.  By law all parents are legally responsible for their children but the Government does little to actually enforce this law.

rejection.details:
It's already possible for people who don't pay child maintenance to be sent to prison for non-payment, or to have deductions taken from their bank account, their earnings or from their benefits. There is more information about this here:

https://www.citizensadvice.org.uk/relationships/children-and-young-people/child-maintenance/child-maintenance-2012-scheme/child-maintenance-enforcement/child-maintenance-enforcement-where-to-start/

We're therefore not sure exactly what action you'd like the Government or Parliament to take.
